New Records: Lane Thomas hit a grand slam off of Tarik Skubal in the bottom of the fifth inning, which was the difference in the game.
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas' grand slam was a game-changer, and the Tigers were unable to recover from the deficit.
Steven Kwan lined a leadoff single to right field to start the bottom of the seventh.
David Fry hit a little dribbler to second base off the end of his bat, and with Keith playing near second base, he couldn’t make the play.
Jose Ramirez just chopped a high bouncer that got over Torkelson and into right field.
Thomas sliced a little bouncer off the end of the bat to the right side and Keith fielded it but had no chance to get the runner and slipped on his pivot anyway.
Bryan Rocchio spanked a grounder back up the middle and through for an RBI single.
Pre-Game Insights: AJ Hinch stocked his lineup with right-handers to try and jump Boyd for an early lead.
The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
Post-Match Reflections: The Tigers will head home after a very successful season and the most shocking and exciting stretch drive in team history.
We can only thank the 2024 Tigers for one heck of a good time.
Now it’s Scott Harris’ job to bolster the rotation and most importantly, to find them a good deal more power in the lineup in 2025.
The Tigers will definitely take solace in the fact that the future looks very bright for the Detroit Tigers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers hit three balls off the wall in this one.

Thomas cleared the wall. That was the difference, and those big homers from Thomas, and David Fry in Game 4, really told the tale as both teams pitched really well and battled out their at-bats throughout the series.
The Tigers struggled with Boyd, and they really needed to put the Guardians under pressure against Skubal.
The Guardians became the first team in a long while to really take it to Skubal.
The game felt like it was on the line already in the third inning.
This really hurts and that’s an experience we haven’t had in a long while.
It’s been an amazing run, but there’s never much consolation when you lose in October.
